about.title: What Public Works Does
text: This department is a combination of two branches that manage all the County’s infrastructure, including: construction projects, solid waste, environmental enforcement, planning, land subdivision and road construction.
Public Works manages all County Roads, Engineering, Capital Projects (Construction projects), Solid Waste, Public Buildings and County Vehicle Maintenance.

people.name: Jason Spencer
people.title: Director
bio: Jason Spencer, APM, serves as Hart County’s Public Works Director, overseeing the planning, organization, and delivery of public works operations across the county. In this role he is responsible for managing county roads, supporting engineering and capital projects, overseeing solid waste operations, coordinating maintenance of public buildings, and directing county vehicle and equipment maintenance. Jason brings more than 20 years of experience in local government and operations leadership, including long-tenured service as a municipal Public Works Director.

An Accredited Pavement Manager (APM), Jason has deep expertise in pavement condition evaluation, project scoping, cost estimating, and long-range capital planning that helps Hart County stretch every transportation dollar. His background also includes extensive work in fleet operations, DOT/FMCSA compliance, HR, and safety, giving him a practical understanding of the people, equipment, and regulatory pieces that make a public works department run effectively.

Jason is actively involved in the American Public Works Association (APWA) – Georgia Chapter, where he has served as Northeast Branch President and Chair of the Scholarship & Internship Committee, promoting professional development and future talent in the public works profession. He is committed to providing responsive, dependable service to Hart County residents and to maintaining the county’s roads, facilities, and infrastructure to a high standard of safety and quality.
